alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 13 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following areas, in central New Hampshire, Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Coos and Southern Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The potential exists for showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening to produce 1.00-1.50" of rain with localized amounts of 2.00-3.00" possible. Rivers and streams are already running high and any additional rainfall will likely go straight to run-off across areas that have recently received heavy rainfall and flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
